author: trimetilo
content:
Hello! I am updating blob-utils to make it work with devnet-11 and I have a branch which can send transactions with blobs now. However the txs remain in the mempool without confirmation. Any idea anyone?

```
eth.getTransaction('0x46387e6754b4275ac940a0f9e309499bce097114a3dc91e2ca70beec8f3db687');
{
  accessList: [],
  blobVersionedHashes: ["0x018df59ea0e06856600198dbab80039388ca10e1ce150489c32ee19e319fd4e7"],
  blockHash: null,
  blockNumber: null,
  chainId: "0x1a1f0ff45",
  from: "0x760005deaae1c79146529dbb6eed12a7b15d015a",
  gas: 21000,
  gasPrice: 10000000000000,
  hash: "0x46387e6754b4275ac940a0f9e309499bce097114a3dc91e2ca70beec8f3db687",
  input: "0x",
  maxFeePerBlobGas: "0xb2d05e00",
  maxFeePerGas: 10000000000000,
  maxPriorityFeePerGas: 2000000000,
  nonce: 2,
  r: "0xfc0e4dd9e678b4fbc5085ce1ecda549cbf5ec8ac2f7b0c3dc29846c91717e06a",
  s: "0x5130b05134bfdffdc3a1b4907f43e18fefbb7fc2344ac7c77e3dd7783bd8e380",
  to: "0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000",
  transactionIndex: null,
  type: "0x3",
  v: "0x1",
  value: 0,
  yParity: "0x1"
}
```

author: trimetilo
content: Ok got it working! (the account I was using had already sent many txs that were unconfirmed due to low gas - using a new account solved it)
